CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged with the Mayor of PERSON ( Urząd Miasta ) an application to transform his right of perpetual use ( prawo użytkowania wieczystego ) of a piece of real property into a right of ownership . He relied on the provisions of DATE PERSON on Transforming Perpetual Use Vested in Individuals into Ownership ( ustawa o przekształceniu prawa użytkowania wieczystego przysługującego osobom fizycznym w prawo własności ) ( “ the CARDINAL LAW ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor informed the applicant that , due to a judgment of ORG ( PERSON ) which found some provisions of LAW to be incompatible with the LAW , he could not give a decision in the case within the statutory time - limit of DATE , and set a new time - limit of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor informed the applicant that , due to some changes to LAW , a valuation report concerning the property ( operat szacunkowy ) had to be drawn up and a new time - limit set , DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG ( PERSON ) about inactivity on the part of the administrative authority .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Appeal found the applicant 's complaint well - founded and ordered the Mayor to give a decision on the merits within DATE of the delivery of its decision .

CARDINAL . The Mayor did not give the decision within the prescribed timelimit . Instead , on DATE , the Mayor issued a procedural decision ( postanowienie ) setting another time - limit , DATE , and informing the applicant that the decision could not be appealed against and that it could be challenged only when a decision on the merits had been given .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again asked the Mayor to give a decision in his case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor informed the applicant that , due to further changes to LAW , by a decision of CARDINAL DATE the proceedings for transforming his right had been discontinued and that proceedings for ex lege acquisition of the property in question had been instituted .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor again informed the applicant that the matter could not be resolved within the statutory time - limit and set a new time - limit of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again complained to ORG about the inactivity of the administrative authority .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Appeal found the complaint justified and ordered the Mayor to give a decision in that connection within DATE of the delivery of its decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor gave a decision on the merits and refused to acknowledge an ex lege acquisition of the property by the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Appeal quashed the challenged decision and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor gave a further decision and again refused to acknowledge an ex lege acquisition of the property .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Appeal again quashed the challenged decision and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Mayor gave a decision , again a refusal .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant did not appeal against that decision .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law concerning inactivity on the part of administrative authorities is set out in the ORG 's judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE .
